variable.name: R_het_soil_C
method.notes: Use in-growth cores and sequential coring to estim

variable.name: R_auto_C
method.notes: calculated based on specific tissue biomass and respiration response functions

variable.name: R_soil_C
method.notes: closed dynamic chamber method with an infra-red gas analyser and soil respiration chamber

variable.name: R_auto_C
method.notes: biomass, temperature function adjusted by Ra_folia

method.citation: Aide_1995_fria; Chan_2013_eoam; Saldarriaga_1988_lcof; Sierra_2007_satv; Sierra_2012_tcai; Uhl_1984_sand; Uhl_1987_fcsf
variable.name: biomass_ag_OM
biomass_ag_OM
method.notes: measure the diameter of all trees that are_100_mm in diameter in a given area (mean 2.1_ha) at least twice (mean interval 9.4_years), and apply allometric equations to convert tree-diameter measurements to carbon content

variable.name: ANPP
method.notes: ANPP was calculated by adding tree biomass increment and litterfall during the period of measurement. Aboveground tree biomass was estimated allometrically using tree inventory data and biomass-diameter relation

variable.name: biomass_ag_OM
method.notes: Aboveground tree biomass was estimated allometrically using tree inventory data and biomass-diameter relation

variable.name: ANPP
method.notes: ANPP was calculated by adding tree biomass increment and litterfall during the period of measurement. Pine, mahogany, and roble (Tabebuia heterophylla (DC.) Britton) trees were harvested to supplement available biomass information on these species. Least squares regression analysis was used to develop bio- mass-diameter relation

variable.name: biomass_ag_OM
method.notes: Pine, mahogany, and roble (Tabebuia heterophylla (DC.) Britton) trees were harvested to supplement available biomass information on these species. Least squares regression analysis was used to develop biomass-diameter relation

variable.name: ANPP_woody_stem_C
method.notes: Where the individual tree data (including taxonomy) are available, we use allometric equation (Baker et al. 2004) to directly estimate the above-ground biomass at every census.

method.citation: Hughes_1999_bcan; Zarin_2001_pbai; Gehring_2005_rosf; Letcher_2009_rrob; Becknell_2014_saas; Delaney_1997_tdoo; Baker_2004_ibia
variable.name: biomass_ag_OM
organic.layer_OM
method.notes: multiplying the concentration of organic matter at the center of each soil horizon in the 1 x 1 x 1 m pit by the thickness of the horizon and its bulk density

variable.name: biomass_ag_OM
method.notes: Measured DBH, height, crown exposure; allometric relations

variable.name: deadwood_OM
method.notes: down dead wood sampled using line intersect method (Brown 1974); standing dead wood using allometric relations subtracting 10%

variable.name: biomass_root_OM
method.notes: root biomass from root-to-shoot ratios (0.48 dry forests, 0.22 montane moist, 0.16 lowland moist; Sanford and Cuevas 1996)

variable.name: soil_C
method.notes: Soil samples at 5 depths and surface soils and mineral soils

variable.name: ANPP_woody_branch_OM
method.notes: Harvest (branches > 2 cm diameter), larger branches measured diameter at 3 points, assigned wood density value

variable.name: ANPP_foliage_OM
method.notes: Litter traps, separated into components, oven dried and weighed

method.citation: Malhi_2014_tpma; Araujo-Murakami_2014_tpaa; da Costa_2014_eran; del Aguila-Pasquel_2014_tsco; Doughty_2014_tpaa; Rocha_2014_epac
variable.name: ANPP_folivory_OM
method.notes: Leaves collected in litterfall traps photographed before drying. Leaves scanned to calculate leaf area lost to herbivory. The fractional herbivory (H) for each leaf was calculated (see Table 3)

variable.name: R_auto_C
method.notes: Ra = Rleaf + Rstem + Rrhizosphere + Rcoarse root

variable.name: R_auto_foliage_C
method.notes: Leaf gas exchange measurements of Rdark were performed using infra-red gas analysers

variable.name: R_auto_wood_C
method.notes: Bole respiration was measured using a closed dynamic chamber method with an IRGA (EGM-4) and soil respiration chamber (SRC-1) connected to a permanent collar, sealed to the tree bole surface

variable.name: GPP
method.notes: GPP = NPPtotal + Ra = plant carbon expenditure PCE, Metcalfe et al. 2010

variable.name: biomass_root_OM
method.notes: Root biomass sampled from pits and used to develop regression equations

variable.name: LAI
method.notes: Yearly LAI was calculated by multiplying the average leaf area/mass value for each life form by the estimated leaf biomass in each life form and then summing over life forms.

variable.name: biomass_root_OM
method.notes: Root weight was estimated by proportion from the rela- tionship in the two destructively sampled trees

variable.name: ANPP_repro_OM
method.notes: Litter traps, separated into components, oven dried and weighed

variable.name: ANPP
method.notes: ANPP was estimated by summing annual litterfall accumulation (897 g/m2/year) plus biomass change due to delayed mortality (142 g/m2/year) plus estimated herbivory (25 g/m2/year)

variable.name: ANPP
method.notes: ANPP is mean periodic aboveground production plus mean annual litterfall

variable.name: ANPP
method.notes: ANPP was calculated by combining litter (leaf+branch) and growth data (allometric relations based on height and diameter).

variable.name: ANPP_folivory_OM
method.notes: from caterpillar frass in littertraps, and assuming 13% efficiency; this = 4.4% of leaf prod.

variable.name: ANPP_folivory_OM
method.notes: Comes out to about 9% of ANPP; tracked leaf studies.

variable.name: ANPP_folivory_OM
method.notes: Followed herbivory of tagged leaves over 3 mo., to 12 m ht. maximum, got 1% herbivory in 90 days, extrapolated to 4% over a year;converted to /ha with LAI values based on plumb bob data and standing leaf biomass from mass/area relation.

variable.name: ANPP_folivory_OM
method.notes: estimated annual herbivory rates by ants in the area as 16% of leaf standing biomass (based on J. C. Giraldo and R. A. Bedoya, unpublished entomological data).

variable.name: ANPP_folivory_OM
method.notes: Leaf herbivory rate (grazing by caterpillars, assuming efficiency of assimilation at 13%)

variable.name: ANPP_folivory_OM
method.notes: See Filip et al. 1995. Loss of leaf mass to herbivores was determined from repeated measurements of damage on individually labeled leaves; percent leaf area also measured using discrete measurements over a 3-year period (1983-1985); For the long-term measurements, percent leaf area eaten measured by leaf tracing.

variable.name: biomass_ag_OM
method.notes: Measured dbh, total height, and crown base height for tree species > 1.5 cm dbh; measured total height and crown diameter for shrub species and tree species < 1.5 cm dbh; entered into allometric equations

variable.name: biomass_ag_C
method.notes: Measured diameter of all stems following CTFS-ForestGEO protocol, estimated biomass based on allometries. Estimated C as 47% of biomass.

variable.name: delta.agb_C
method.notes: Measured diameter of all stems in repeat censuses following CTFS-ForestGEO protocol, estimated biomass based on allometries, calculated net biomass change as difference between the two censuses divided by census interval

variable.name: ANPP_woody_stem_C
method.notes: Measured diameter of all stems in repeat censuses following CTFS-ForestGEO protocol, estimated biomass based on allometries, calculated woody productivity as summed changes in biomass of individual stems divided by census inverval

variable.name: woody.mortality_ag_C
method.notes: Measured diameter of all stems following CTFS-ForestGEO protocol, estimated biomass based on allometries, calculated woody mortality as summed biomass of all stems that died divided by census interval

variable.name: biomass_ag_OM
method.notes: Measured diameter of all stems following CTFS-ForestGEO protocol, estimated biomass based on allometries.

variable.name: woody.mortality_ag_OM
method.notes: Measured diameter of all stems following CTFS-ForestGEO protocol, estimated biomass based on allometries of main stems, calculated woody mortality as summed biomass of all trees that died divided by census interval

variable.name: ANPP_woody_stem_OM
method.notes: Measured diameter of all stems in repeat censuses following CTFS-ForestGEO protocol, estimated biomass based on allometries, calculated woody productivity as summed changes in biomass of individual stems divided by census inverval

variable.name: delta.agb_OM
method.notes: Measured diameter of all stems in repeat censuses following CTFS-ForestGEO protocol, estimated biomass based on allometries, calculated net biomass change as difference between the two censuses divided by census interval

variable.name: GPP
method.notes: Estimated from daytime partitioning method; variable USTAR threshold, with reference selected from GPP versions using model efficiency (MEF)

variable.name: GPP
method.notes: Estimated from nighttime partitioning method; variable USTAR threshold, with reference selected from GPP versions using model efficiency (MEF)
